results.title: Introducing the map
results.creator_credit: Frank Wells, Gaumont-British Instructional and S.G. Fergusson
results.brief_description: Shows how the rudiments of map reading may be learned through a simple study of local geography. Two children arrive in the country and engage in an exploring game. Three flags placed in different parts of the village are marked on a map; each flag to be found with the assistance of the map and an aerial photograph. The instructional approach throughout the film is indirect and simple.

results.title: Introducing the Eucalypts
results.creator_credit: Paul Broady and Video Education Australia
results.brief_description: This program covers the main features of our Eucalypts: their identifying characteristics (especially the bark, flower buds and leaves), adaptability, distribution patterns, growth and type of timber produced, and their human and non-human uses.

results.title: Introducing the atom
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Atoms for Peace”.
An overall introduction to the series. Provides a basic explanation of atomic energy. Animated sequences demonstrate the make-up, function, formation and controlled chain reaction. It shows the atomic pile at Los Alamos and the preparation and storage of radio-isotopes at Oak Ridge. Touches on the uses of atomic materials in medical research, agriculture and industry. The film ends with excerpts from President Eisenhower’s speech before the United Nations, emphasising America’s hopes and desires for International control of atomic energy dedicated to human welfare everywhere.

results.title: Introducing Shakespeare
results.brief_description: This film is designed to provide a background against which Shakespeare’s life and ideas may be presented. Opens with scenes of Stratford and surrounding countryside, which formed the background to Shakespeare’s early life and work. Elizabethan London is illustrated by details of Visscher’s View of London of 1616. A full-scale model of an Elizabethan stage is shown and the use of the various acting areas described.

results.title: Introducing photography with a pinhole camera
results.creator_credit: Alexander Milsky and A M Productions
results.brief_description: A simple pinhole camera is designed and demonstrated. Developing and printing is shown. The use of different size cameras (boxes) are explained and demonstrated in animation.

results.title: Introducing O and M
results.creator_credit: Anvil Films and British Productivity Council
results.brief_description: The introduction of an organisation and methods man into a large company. Emphasises the need for a new outlook by management and staff before he can start his work, and follows the course of the O and M (Organisation and Methods) investigation.

results.title: Introducing New Zealand
results.brief_description: A survey of New Zealand showing the scenery, primary and secondary industries, cities and towns during the 1950s. Stresses that the economy of the country rested on exports of meat, wool and dairy produce. Shows some of the recreational activities of the people including football, bush walking, sailing and fishing.
